nodes.bodyText: Can you explain why this is ifdef'd out? Ordinarily we wouldn't accept ifdef'd out code since it is likely to rot and isn't tested or compiled....

Making this public seems suboptimal - the isolation provided by the previous private declaration helps to prevent accidental corruption of the profiling data. Is there an overall design for this work that explains this design choice?
Can you please add doxygen for newly added APIs to explain what they do, their requirements, results and side-effects?

This seems like, it is doing same as part of the code couple of lines before in TR_BlockFrequencyInfo::serialize(uint8_t * &buffer) const , is it possible to refactor the common part out to a function?

I do not think so IS_VALID_BIT_VECTOR is the correct name here.
IIRC low tagged entry means we need to just get the counter from single block to either add or subtract, otherwise, it should hold the array of bit vector representing counters from blocks added and subtracted together to get the frequency. I am not sure if this is the correct check. Take a look at the comment here,
https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/blob/b2400f9240b80a0a41d314ddc5768a42915a69ca/runtime/compiler/runtime/J9Profiler.hpp#L660-L663

Yeah, I think missing NULL check should be there.
What I meant originally is the name IS_VALID_BIT_VECTOR , the name seems more generic but the check is internal to BlockFrequencyInfo, so IMO it should either a name that justifies the internal use, or a private static method (To make code more readable) instead of the macro

+    * Also see getSizeForSerialization(), deserialize(uint8_t * &).
+    */
+   void serialize(uint8_t * &buffer) const;

+    * @note This method does not check agains buffer over-reads. The caller should ensure that the
